intro: Cycnium adonense var. adscendens, commonly known as the ascending wild cucumber, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes other cucurbits such as pumpkins and melons. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces yellow flowers that develop into spiny, orange-brown fruits. Its botanical characteristics make it distinguishable from other species in the genus Cycnium, particularly in its growth habit and fruit morphology.
